definition: Pierre Simon Laplace (1749-1827), French mathematician
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
general/popular/everywhere/universal
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
(phonetic)/this
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: The generalized Riesz summability operators of Laplace series are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 引進了拉普拉斯級數的廣義黎斯可和算子。

sentences.english: These blocks for precise matching were selected by Laplacian transformation of reference image.
sentences.chinese: 進行匹配的小塊是根據參考幀的拉普拉斯變換選取的。

sentences.english: The laplace-transform method is only applicable to the frequency domain analysis for linear circuits.
sentences.chinese: 拉普拉斯變換法只適用於線性電路的頻域分析。

sentences.english: Finally, by applying Laplace numerical inversion technique the solutions in time domain can be obtained.
sentences.chinese: 最後應用拉普拉斯數值反演技術得到時間域的解。

sentences.english: This paper studies the universal inequalities of eigenvalues for higher order Laplacians on spherical domains.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了球面域上高階拉普拉斯的特徵值問題。
拉普拉斯78歲逝世時依然年輕。

sentences.english: Surface Laplacian of the body surface potential (Laplacian ECG-LECG) is a new approach to resolve spatially distributed bioelectrical source.
sentences.chinese: 表面拉普拉斯是一種高空間分辨率的體表勢分析方法。

sentences.english: In the present paper, the Laplacian spectrum of coronas was studied.
sentences.chinese: 主要研究冠的拉普拉斯譜。

sentences.english: Laplace, the astronomer, was still at work when death caught up with him at seventy-eight.
sentences.chinese: 法國天文學家拉普拉斯78歲死時還在工作着。
